title: Suspect arrested in connection with shooting death
content:
COLUMBIA — Tyrone James Jr. was arrested Saturday on suspicion on second-degree murder and armed criminal action, according to a Columbia Police Department press release. James turned himself in.
The department issued a warrant for the 18-year-old's arrest with a $1 million bond Thursday, after Marquez D. Reed, 17, was shot to death Wednesday in central Columbia.
Police had already arrested Jadarius C. Sanders, 18, who had told police that he drove the vehicle James was inside during the shooting, according to previous Missourian reporting. Sanders was charged with hindering the prosecution of a felony and tampering with physical evidence.
In the release, the department thanked "the citizens of Columbia for coming forward with information which led to the quick arrests."
